title: Can't login to NY Times site using Firefox
content:
I can't login to the NY Times website using Firefox. I'm sure I'm using the correct password because I can log in using a different browser. I don't save passwords in Firefox. I enter them manually or use a password manager. As I said, I'm certain I'm using a valid password. I've cleared the cookies and all of the items under History on the Settings page. When I close Firefox, nothing is saved. When I contact NYT customer service, I was informed that they've had a lot of requests for assistance from Firefox users, and nothing was out of order with those users' NYT login; the problem was with Firefox.

Please advise.
creator: kenr2

title: I do not want the new Firefox View. How do I reject this update?
content:
Tell me how to reject the "New" Firefox View. I do not want Firefox as my browser on my mobile device. I want my "old" Firefox browser page!

I am not a "programmer" I am not tech savvy! at 79 years I don't want to waste my time trying answer questions that I don't even understand.

If I can't get the version I was using last week, I will be forced to discontinue using Firefox since I can't access the previous version of Firefox browser.
creator: chuck-char

title: False warning for https: sites
content: Why does Firefox warn me that I'm going to an http: site when I am not?
creator: bob211

title: Due to the recent upgrade from Firefox, my add-on of Mailvelope has lost all keys and I can not access sites without my original mailvelope encrytion
content: Due to the recent upgrade of the Firefox browser for windows, my add-on for Mailvelope did not sync and I have lost all my encryption settings. I do not have the original key and don't know how to recover the previous version. At this point I am locked out of important sites without my original encryption keys and the keys to those sources. I really need the November 2022 version of Mailvelope. Please help. Thank you.
creator: swansonsound

title: How do I get rid of the clicking and little "sticks" that start to block up the window where I want to write a place to ask a question?
content:
I am trying to block out the new little "stick marks" that post while I try to log on to a site that that I need to "google" and log on to. I tried to sign out of all the "outside sites" that want to log on, but there are sites that I need to log on to and have done this in the past. I usually go to these sites because they are important to my transacting business, accessing my bank, places I pay my bills, etc. If I want to get to these and order or pay a bill, I have to unblock each one of them??? How do I do that? If a credit company wants to contact me, they cannot do this even if we have contacted each other previously? Really?

How do I undo this already-marked system and get out of it? As you can guess, I am old and not up with the times. Please simplify your answers so a not-technical person can understand it.
creator: mfbgarza

title: Firefox issue with downloads still not working correcly.
content:
This issue needs to be corrected as it is causing problems.

As you will see from the attached acreenshots, when a file wants to be downloaded, I get the expected Ask options and even though I selected Open with Adobe it still downloads the file.

Picture 1 shows the options, picture 2 shows the file open in Adobe, picture 3 shows it downloaded to my PC and picture 4 shows that I selected Always ask you where to save files so why is the file still downloading.

It creates a nuisance as I only want to open most files and if I decide to save them, I can do that so why is Firefox still saving files whether I want to or notÂ !?!

Now I have to go to the file, delete it and empty the recycle bin for security reasons so this issue needs to be resolved as it used to work fine in previous version of Firefox.

Maybe there is a setting that I need to change so any suggestions on how to fix this would be appreciated.

I am currently running Firefox 109.0 (64-bit) on Windows 10, Version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.2486).


Thanks.
creator: Hawkeye58
